Responsibilities: Job profile

The SOC Analyst (L1) is responsible for continuous monitoring, first-level triage, and initial response actions based on approved SOC playbooks. The role focuses on accurate classification of alerts, rapid escalation of true security events, and maintaining high-quality case records to support investigations.

Responsibilities

- Monitor SIEM and security tooling queues; review alerts, events, and anomalies across endpoints, identity, email, and network sources.
- Perform initial triage: validate alert context, enrich with basic data (user, host, IP, geolocation, asset criticality), and determine severity.
- Create and maintain incident tickets with complete evidence, timeline, and actions taken; ensure accurate categorization and tagging.
- Execute approved first-response playbooks (e.g., phishing triage, user verification steps, initial containment requests, password reset escalation).
- Escalate suspected incidents to L2 within defined SLAs; ensure smooth handover with clear notes and supporting artifacts.
- Support SOC reporting by maintaining disciplined ticket hygiene and shift handover notes.
- Continuously improve alert quality by flagging false positives, missing telemetry, or recurring issues to the SOC Lead/SIEM Engineer.

Core competencies

- Meticulous attention to detail and strong documentation discipline.
- Ability to work shifts and remain effective under pressure.
- Curiosity and structured thinking‚Äîable to follow playbooks while spotting anomalies.
- Strong communication and teamwork skills.

Job Nature / Shift:

This role may be shift-based to support SOC coverage requirements (including weekends and public holidays as per shift rota). Shift patterns will be structured (e.g., 8-hour shifts) with rest days managed through the rota.

Reporting line

The SOC Analyst shall report to SOC Lead / Incident Response Lead (as applicable)

Compensation & Benefits:

- Competitive and attractive salary package will be offered to deserving candidates based on experience and skill set.
- Festival Bonus
- Provident Fund & Gratuity
- Life & Health Insurance (IPD & OPD)
- Annual Health Check-up
- Baisakhi Allowance
- Vehicle Loan Scheme / Vehicle Maintenance Allowance

Requirements: Education and Experience:
- Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Cyber Security/IT/Information Security or similar.
- 1‚Äì3 years‚Äô experience in SOC operations, IT security, NOC with security monitoring exposure, or related discipline.
- Good written and spoken English; able to produce clear tickets and shift handovers.
- Comfortable operating in a multi-country environment and supporting distributed teams.

Required knowledge and Technical Skills:
- Basic understanding of cybersecurity concepts: malware, phishing, brute force, lateral movement, data exfiltration, and common attack patterns.
- Foundational SIEM experience (alert review, dashboards, simple queries). Experience with Wazuh is preferred.

job_title: Sr. SOC Analyst ‚Äì Investigation & Incident Handling
job_description:
Responsibilities: Job profile
The Sr. SOC Analyst conducts in-depth investigations of escalated alerts and suspected incidents, confirms scope and impact, coordinates containment actions with IT and business stakeholders, and drives incidents to closure with appropriate evidence and reporting.

Responsibilities
- Investigate escalated alerts using SIEM/EDR/email/identity/network telemetry to confirm incident validity, scope, and root cause hypotheses.
- Perform correlation across multiple data sources and build incident timelines; identify affected users, systems, and data at risk.
- Coordinate containment and remediation with local IT teams (endpoint isolation, account disable/reset, blocking IOCs, firewall/VPN actions) per approved procedures.
- Lead incident communications for assigned cases: maintain stakeholder updates, ensure actions are tracked, and escalate to Lead Information Security when thresholds are met.
- Collect and preserve evidence in line with internal standards (logs, screenshots, hashes, email headers, EDR artifacts) to support audit/regulatory reporting.
- Support development and refinement of playbooks/runbooks and detection logic by providing feedback to SIEM Engineer and Lead Information Security.
- Conduct post-incident reviews for assigned incidents and propose preventive controls and monitoring improvements.

Core competencies
- Strong analytical and investigative mindset; able to distinguish signal from noise.
- Structured incident handling and stakeholder coordination.
- High-quality documentation and reporting, including executive-ready summaries when required.
- Mentorship: supports L1 analysts through guidance and coaching.

Reporting line
The Sr. SOC Analyst shall report to Lead Information Security (as applicable)

Compensation & Benefits:
- Competitive and attractive salary package will be offered to deserving candidates based on experience and skill set.
- Festival Bonus
- Provident Fund & Gratuity
- Life & Health Insurance (IPD & OPD)
- Annual Health Check-up
- Baisakhi Allowance
- Vehicle Loan Scheme / Vehicle Maintenance Allowance

Requirements: Education and Experience:
- Bachelor‚Äôs degree in CSE/IT/Information Security or similar.
- 3‚Äì6 years‚Äô experience in SOC/incident response/security operations; financial services experience preferred.
- Experience with SIEM and Microsoft/Azure security solutions is preferred.

Certifications (preferred):
- Incident handling/SOC: GCIH, GCIA, CEH, Security+, or equivalent.
- Vendor certifications (Microsoft security, Wazuh) are an advantage.

Required knowledge and Technical Skills:
- Hands-on investigation skills across SIEM, EDR, email security, and identity logs.
- Good understanding of Windows security events, common attacker techniques, and incident scoping methods.
- Ability to run basic threat hunting queries and pivot between telemetry sources.
- Understanding of financial services threat scenarios (phishing/BEC, credential theft, privileged access abuse, ranso
